{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3604898,"name":"","username":"Joseph_K","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joseph_k/{size}/245868_2.png","created_at":"2025-04-27T02:32:30.159Z","cooked":"

Title is (hopefully) self explanatory. I am designing a robot in Onshape, and am using the CheeseIt! featurescript to lighten the plates. This however, is dramatically slowing it down. It has gotten to the point where the part studio won’t load if I try to recalculate the pattern. I am unsure if anyone else has had this issue, much less know how to fix it. It may be because of the complexity of the part, but I am unsure.

image718×628 45.4 KB

current parameters

It is a 3d printed part, and is not 2d.

From my experience it’s pretty normal for cheeseit to absolutely murder part studios, I would recommend deriving the part into another studio/document and running the featurescript there so you can work on whatever else is in the main studio without having to run it over and over again.

well, that’s unfortunate, as I need to edit the cheeseit. I might just apply the weight reduction pattern manually at this point. Also because patchit slows the part studio even more

I highly recommend the “2471 FeatureScripts” The part lightning one is very easy to use and does not lag part studios. There are also many other FRC specific featurescripts in along with the lightning one that help streamline the design process.

I just tried their lightening one, and it is so much faster to calculate. I will now only have to figure out the rib positions to maintain structural integrity.

I would recommend using the cheseit! to generate rib lines, then lighten it with 2471’s part lighten.
